verses.verse: Thou shalt not see<WH7200> thy brother's<WH251> ox<WH7794> or his sheep<WH7716> go astray<WH5080>, and hide<WH5956> thyself from them: thou shalt in any case<WH7725> bring them again<WH7725> unto thy brother<WH251>.

And if thy brother<WH251> be not nigh<WH7138> unto thee, or if thou know<WH3045> him not, then thou shalt bring<WH622> it unto<WH8432> thine own house<WH1004>, and it shall be with thee until thy brother<WH251> seek<WH1875> after it, and thou shalt restore it to him again<WH7725>.

In like manner<WH3651> shalt thou do<WH6213> with his ass<WH2543>; and so shalt thou do<WH6213> with his raiment<WH8071>; and with all lost thing<WH9> of thy brother's<WH251>, which he hath lost<WH6>, and thou hast found<WH4672>, shalt thou do<WH6213> likewise: thou mayest<WH3201> not hide<WH5956> thyself.

¶ Thou shalt not see<WH7200> thy brother's<WH251> ass<WH2543> or his ox<WH7794> fall down<WH5307> by the way<WH1870>, and hide<WH5956> thyself from them: thou shalt surely<WH6965> help him to lift them up again<WH6965>.

¶ The woman<WH802> shall not wear that which pertaineth<WH3627> unto a man<WH1397>, neither shall a man<WH1397> put<WH3847> on a woman's<WH802> garment<WH8071>: for all that do<WH6213> so<WH428> are abomination<WH8441> unto the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.

¶ If a bird's<WH6833> nest<WH7064> chance<WH7122> to be before<WH6440> thee in the way<WH1870> in any tree<WH6086>, or on the ground<WH776>, whether they be young ones<WH667>, or eggs<WH1000>, and the dam<WH517> sitting<WH7257> upon the young<WH667>, or upon the eggs<WH1000>, thou shalt not take<WH3947> the dam<WH517> with the young<WH1121>:

But thou shalt in any wise<WH7971> let the dam<WH517> go<WH7971>, and take<WH3947> the young<WH1121> to thee; that it may be well<WH3190> with thee, and that thou mayest prolong<WH748> thy days<WH3117>.

¶ When thou buildest<WH1129> a new<WH2319> house<WH1004>, then thou shalt make<WH6213> a battlement<WH4624> for thy roof<WH1406>, that thou bring<WH7760> not blood<WH1818> upon thine house<WH1004>, if any man<WH5307> fall<WH5307> from thence.

¶ Thou shalt not sow<WH2232> thy vineyard<WH3754> with divers seeds<WH3610>: lest the fruit<WH4395> of thy seed<WH2233> which thou hast sown<WH2232>, and the fruit<WH8393> of thy vineyard<WH3754>, be defiled<WH6942>.
¶ Thou shalt not plow<WH2790> with an ox<WH7794> and an ass<WH2543> together<WH3162>.
¶ Thou shalt not wear<WH3847> a garment of divers sorts<WH8162>, as of woollen<WH6785> and linen<WH6593> together<WH3162>.
¶ Thou shalt make<WH6213> thee fringes<WH1434> upon the four<WH702> quarters<WH3671> of thy vesture<WH3682>, wherewith thou coverest<WH3680> thyself.
¶ If any man<WH376> take<WH3947> a wife<WH802>, and go in<WH935> unto her, and hate<WH8130> her,

And give<WH7760> occasions<WH5949> of speech<WH1697> against her, and bring up<WH3318> an evil<WH7451> name<WH8034> upon her, and say<WH559>, I took<WH3947> this woman<WH802>, and when I came<WH7126> to her, I found<WH4672> her not a maid<WH1331>:

Then shall the father<WH1> of the damsel<WH5291>, and her mother<WH517>, take<WH3947> and bring forth<WH3318> the tokens of the damsel's<WH5291> virginity<WH1331> unto the elders<WH2205> of the city<WH5892> in the gate<WH8179>:
And the damsel's<WH5291> father<WH1> shall say<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205>, I gave<WH5414> my daughter<WH1323> unto this man<WH376> to wife<WH802>, and he hateth<WH8130> her;

And, lo, he hath given<WH7760> occasions<WH5949> of speech<WH1697> against her, saying<WH559>, I found<WH4672> not thy daughter<WH1323> a maid<WH1331>; and yet these are the tokens of my daughter's<WH1323> virginity<WH1331>. And they shall spread<WH6566> the cloth<WH8071> before<WH6440> the elders<WH2205> of the city<WH5892>.
And the elders<WH2205> of that city<WH5892> shall take<WH3947> that man<WH376> and chastise<WH3256> him;

And they shall amerce<WH6064> him in an hundred<WH3967> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and give<WH5414> them unto the father<WH1> of the damsel<WH5291>, because he hath brought up<WH3318> an evil<WH7451> name<WH8034> upon a virgin<WH1330> of Israel<WH3478>: and she shall be his wife<WH802>; he may<WH3201> not put her away<WH7971> all his days<WH3117>.
But if this thing<WH1697> be true<WH571>, and the tokens of virginity<WH1331> be not found<WH4672> for the damsel<WH5291>:

Then they shall bring out<WH3318> the damsel<WH5291> to the door<WH6607> of her father's<WH1> house<WH1004>, and the men<WH582> of her city<WH5892> shall stone<WH5619> her with stones<WH68> that she die<WH4191>: because she hath wrought<WH6213> folly<WH5039> in Israel<WH3478>, to play the whore<WH2181> in her father's<WH1> house<WH1004>: so shalt thou put<WH1197> evil<WH7451> away<WH1197> from among<WH7130> you.

¶ If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> lying<WH7901> with a woman<WH802> married<WH1166> to an husband<WH1167>, then they shall both of them<WH8147> die<WH4191>, both the man<WH376> that lay<WH7901> with the woman<WH802>, and the woman<WH802>: so shalt thou put away<WH1197> evil<WH7451> from Israel<WH3478>.
¶ If a damsel<WH5291> that is a virgin<WH1330> be betrothed<WH781> unto an husband<WH376>, and a man<WH376> find<WH4672> her in the city<WH5892>, and lie<WH7901> with her;

Then ye shall bring<WH3318> them both<WH8147> out unto the gate<WH8179> of that city<WH5892>, and ye shall stone<WH5619> them with stones<WH68> that they die<WH4191>; the damsel<WH5291>, because<WH834><WH1697> she cried<WH6817> not, being in the city<WH5892>; and the man<WH376>, because<WH834><WH1697> he hath humbled<WH6031> his neighbour's<WH7453> wife<WH802>: so thou shalt put away<WH1197> evil<WH7451> from among<WH7130> you.

¶ But if a man<WH376> find<WH4672> a betrothed<WH781> damsel<WH5291> in the field<WH7704>, and the man<WH376> force<WH2388> her, and lie<WH7901> with her: then the man<WH376> only that lay<WH7901> with her shall die<WH4191>:

But unto the damsel<WH5291> thou shalt do<WH6213> nothing<WH1697>; there is in the damsel<WH5291> no sin<WH2399> worthy of death<WH4194>: for as when a man<WH376> riseth<WH6965> against his neighbour<WH7453>, and slayeth<WH7523><WH5315> him, even so is this matter<WH1697>:
For he found<WH4672> her in the field<WH7704>, and the betrothed<WH781> damsel<WH5291> cried<WH6817>, and there was none to save<WH3467> her.
¶ If a man<WH376> find<WH4672> a damsel<WH5291> that is a virgin<WH1330>, which is not betrothed<WH781>, and lay hold<WH8610> on her, and lie<WH7901> with her, and they be found<WH4672>;

Then the man<WH376> that lay<WH7901> with her shall give<WH5414> unto the damsel's<WH5291> father<WH1> fifty<WH2572> shekels of silver<WH3701>, and she shall be his wife<WH802>; because he hath humbled<WH6031> her, he may<WH3201> not put her away<WH7971> all his days<WH3117>.
¶ A man<WH376> shall not take<WH3947> his father's<WH1> wife<WH802>, nor discover<WH1540> his father's<WH1> skirt<WH3671>.
